comis#

Client#

class comis.Client(client_id, client_secret, user_agent, username, password, subreddits)#

A Client for interacting with Reddit.

Parameters

  • client_id (str) – The client ID for the application.

  • client_secret (str) – The client secret for the application.

  • user_agent (str) – The user agent for the application.

  • username (str) – The username for the account.

  • password (str) – The password for the account.

  • subreddits (list[str]) – The subreddits to monitor.

Examples

from comis import Client

bot = Client(
    client_id="Ur3l0nG3fA5a.dasfh41vcFQA453d",
    client_secret="uAfgk1fhdjlk...",
    user_agent="comis reddit bot by /u/endercheif",
    username="endercheif",
    password="supersecretpassword",
    subreddits=["your_subreddit"],
)

bot.run()

Event#

class comis.main.Event(evt, evt_type, handler, criteria)#
Parameters

  • evt (str) – Event name.

  • evt_type (Literal[‘submission’, ‘comment’]) – Event type.

  • handler (Callable[Submission | Comment, SubmissionModeration | CommentModeration, Awaitable[None]]) – Handler function.

  • criteria (dict[str, Any]) – Criteria to match.

Decorators#

@comis.submission(**kwargs)#

Decorator for handling submission events.

Examples

@submission()
async def handle_submission(self, submission, mod):
    comment = await submission.reply("Beep boop, this is an automated mod message.")
    await comment.mod.distinguish(how="yes", sticky=True)
Return type

Callable[Callable[Submission, SubmissionModeration, Awaitable[None]], Event]

@comis.comment(**kwargs)#

Decorator for handling comment events.

Examples

@comment()
async def handle_comment(self, comment, mod):
     if comment.author == (await self.reddit.user.me()):
         await mod.approve()
         await mod.distinguish(how="yes")
Return type

Callable[Callable[Comment, CommentModeration, Awaitable[None]], Event]
